definition: to live out a pointless existence
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
form of divination similar to the Ouija board, in which participants use their forefingers to push a small saucer over a sheet of paper inscribed with numerous Chinese characters
a ritual whereby the living soul is brought to the nether world for a spiritual journey

Investiture of the Gods, major Ming dynasty vernacular novel of mythology and fantasy, very loosely based on King Wu of Zhou's 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrow of the Shang, subsequent material for opera, film, TV series, computer games etc
three immortal souls and seven mortal forms in Daoism, contrasting the spiritual and carnal side of man
the Yellow Springs/the underworld of Chinese mythology/the equivalent of Hades or Hell

place sb on a field of death and he will fight to live (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to fight desperately when confronting mortal danger/fig. to find a way out of an impasse
pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1

definition: a kind of sleeping gas or smoke used by thieves to incapacitate victims
